comments.body: /cc @eed3si9n. Maybe you'll be able to come up with something here. Here's the background that introduces the need for this: https://github.com/scalameta/scalameta/pull/421/files/5be17c403529e85d39cbac3c9f73723d1acac6b2#r65814536.
@fommil maybe you could provide advice here?

More precisely, I can't fully override `publish-signed` for the `readme` project. 

I do not want to publish this project, just to use it to generate the website via Scalatex. However, `sbt-pgp` insists that I configure a publishing repository for `readme`, otherwise it errors out when I do `sbt publish-signed`, even though I've overridden that task explicitly in my build.
I usually have a separate project that aggregates all my publishable stuff. Often I have integration tests or other random things that I don't want to publish either

we aggregate just the bits we want to publish https://github.com/ensime/ensime-server/blob/2.0/project/EnsimeBuild.scala#L243

note also that if you have a custom test configuration, with its own dependencies, you must add them to `test` and your config or it triggers a bug in ivy that means your `main` config will depend on those jars. Probably not relevant for you but a major source of pain for us.
oh joy, I just realised we are publishing `testutil`... that's probably not right.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +209,213 @@    },
    // TODO: doesn't work at the moment, see https://github.com/sbt/sbt-pgp/issues/42
    publishSigned := publish.value,
    publishLocal := {},
    publishLocalSigned := {},

comments.body: Note: this will have to be remove prior to the pull request to be accepted (Travis will also not be happy). #140 should be accepted first.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +148,152 @@    libraryDependencies <+= (scalaVersion)("org.scala-lang" % "scala-reflect" % _ % "provided"),
    libraryDependencies <+= (scalaVersion)("org.scala-lang" % "scala-compiler" % _ % "provided"),
    libraryDependencies += "plugin" %% "plugin" % "0.1.0-SNAPSHOT" // TODO: change/remove once Martin's work is integrated to SM.
  ) dependsOn (foundation)
